intro: Thunbergia nivea, commonly known as the white thunbergia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink tubular flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a slightly velvety texture. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Thunbergia nivea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its beauty and ability to climb or trail.
